intro: Navarretia leucocephala subsp. leucocephala, commonly known as the white-flowered navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, white, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, often in coastal areas. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Navarretia leucocephala subsp. leucocephala is known for its early blooming period, often flowering in late winter or early spring.
